author: Tomasz Cielecki
comment: Nice animations etc. However, it sets my phone on fire when using it. It keeps the device awake and drains my battery in few hours. If I stop using it the phone behaves fine.

author: Brian Tomlinson
comment: I really love this watch face. It's informative, fun to look at, and very configurable (battery on my LG G Watch is not abused by it thanks to some clearly defined config settings).  My only complaint is that the step counter does not appear to be tied to Google Fit, but rather, is it's own independent thing. I went for a walk with the dog for over an hour and took nearly 10k steps by the watch face's count, but Google Fit did not show the same count at all (substantially less), which means that the watch and phone were not using the same pedometer API.  Other than that, it's still a great watch face and I'll be keeping it :)  EDIT: User error! The watch pedometer is using Google Fit when available! I had to refresh the Google Fit App and web page in order for the steps to match up. Step for step they are the same, so yes, this watch face gets zero complaints from me :)

author: Laura West
comment: Would really like the option to set my own complications. Extra star if this function ever gets added

author: Olexiy Kovtunenko
comment: I like it. Very useful and cool looking

author: Robert Eaton
comment: Neato

author: Dennis Xie
comment: The animations and colours are nice, but the small widgets need to auto align and space themselves out. For example, if I removed the Google Fit function, the other 2 will not shift inwards to utilise the space. Ohh.. Google Fit didn't work for me anyway (even after giving permission)..
title: Fairly Nice

author: Omar Gonzalez
comment: Problems with weather not refreshing or steps being counted. Should have a set location feature instead of having location services constantly on. You can turn off these features but looks face looks empty.
title: Bugs

author: Carlos Chrysântho
comment: This watch face is great, but step counter isn't working. I woke up and it says I got 6k steps already ._.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content: Hi, this is an old value from previous day, due to battery consumption is this value refreshed only 4times per hour or when you open the fit detail on your watch. Then will be this value updated with your paired phone.

title: I Loved it, but

author: Tiffani Caron
comment: I absolutely love this - its adorable ~ only thing is I wish it displayed phone battery. The seascape face does but I love the clouds and mountain so much i keep switching back.
title: It's so cute!

author: Robin Hebert
comment: It's so cute. And it's amazing all the info. Can you make another one with trees and flowers just like that? By the way the possibilities are endless. I can think of sheep on a hill....birds, etc. Keep up the amazing quality and I'll buy every one. Its my favorite watch face.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi Robin,
great idea, we will add it to our next app list.

title: I love it

author: Lui Yay
comment: Too good for me to be writing this text right now! Amazing 🙋
title: Awesome

author: Mark Heatlie
comment: One of the best face 😔

author: Justin F
comment: Not a bad little watch face. Gives me a ton of information which I like. It's why I wanted a Smartwatch to begin with. I'll change my rating if they add more color selections or ability to change fonts. Animations aren't the greatest. Can barely see the boat and I'd like the balloon going side to side vs up or down. Also phone charge on the screen as well
title: Cute Face

author: Paul Vitorino
comment: App keeps saying it's not connected, even though Android Wear shows it is. Step counter rarely works, and weather never updates. It looks good, but it's completely useless on LG Urbane with Nexus 6P....

author: Dennis Bazemore
comment: Cool app. I got it little while ago and I love the functions of it and no problems so far and if I have any you will heard from me here and F.B. Twitter and anywhere else I can think of I'll let you know it's a bad app just as I will let you know it's a good app. So far AWESOME.
title: Really cool app

author: Matt Barlow
comment: This is definitely the best watchface I've downloaded and I'll likely use it more than any other on my Sony Smartwatch 3 . The whole experience is smooth and I really like the genuinely useful weather, fitness and battery subsections. I look forward to updates!
title: Excellent watch face

author: j. cababe
comment: watch face but my steps are always zero even though it changes in the Google Fit wear app.  LG G3 and Moto 360 2nd gen.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi Johny,
Please try this:
1. Try to look to the Google Fit application in your watches, if steps counter works (steps counter is not 0).
2. Try to re allow the Google Fit API and be sure, you are granted permissions to the right Google account (if you have multiple accounts) - http://prntscr.com/8w6lwx
3. If still not working - Reinstall the app

title: Nice

author: Joanne T
comment: It's a lovely 'live wallpaper'. Has weather, step counter and it finishes off my Sony Smart Watch 3 nicely 👍😀
title: Love it!

author: Brandon Bates
comment: I absolutely love this watch face. The developer is great at attention to detail and is always updating the face with new features. There may have been a slight bug in the latest update that moved the interactive buttons to the bottom right of the icons according to the touch indicators. I'm not sure if it's just me or if it's related to the latest update. If the developer can chime in, that would be great
title: Great watch face, but recent update...

author: Brandon Trivett
comment: This is definitely one of my favourite watch faces and they'll probably have it on my watch for quite some time. The only thing I wish I could have is the ability to change the battery indicator to read my cell phone's battery instead of the watches. If the developer could please add that, I would give this a five star. Either way, thank you very much. It's hard to find a good watch face.
title: Love it with one request...

author: Keith Holmes
comment: Nice in every aspect. It Works flawlessly on LG g watch
title: Very nice!

author: Jason Platt
comment: I'm really in love with this watch face, but it's missing a very important piece of information. Please add the option to show the phone battery level instead of one of the other indicators. I turned off the step-counter and that space is blank. It's the perfect spot to show a meter for the phone battery.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi Jason thanks for feedback.
We will add this feature in one of upcoming releases
Pavel

title: Overall, an excellent watch face. But it's missing something.

author: B Nguyen
comment: Love the cheery and colorful graphics.  Can't stop touching my watch to see the whimsical animation.   Weather is accurate but wish it was displayed in dim mode.  The only gripe is the sharp visual break that splits the top and bottom of watch face, kind of glaring.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi,
thank you for feedback.
The visual break that splits the top and bottom is due to better visibility of time and indicators, when I tested the watchface, without the split, the visibility was horrible. But when I tested whole screen with black overlay, then the colorful graphics and animation was not visible well. It a compromise.

author: patrick siglin
comment: Does not ever update can't make changes on gear live
title: Not working on gear live

author: Jason Chandler
comment: Love the look has everything i was looking for but i cant get the steps to count.  How do i start getting the steps to add up?

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi Jason,
if steps are always 0, then check this..

For the step issue:
Check the status of Google Fit API and disconect the WatchFace  
workflow: http://prntscr.com/8w6lwx

After disconnection, run the Active Weather phone application again and the grant the permission to Google Fit API

title: Great face

author: Reed Baker
comment: For some reason it fixed on it's own, but thanks! If it happens again, I'll try to do that.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi Reed,
try to re-set permission for Google Fit

Check the status of Google Fit API and disconect the WatchFace  
workflow: http://prntscr.com/8w6lwx

After disconnection, run the Active Weather phone application again and then grant the permission to Google Fit API

title: Amazing

author: Derek Trout
comment: Seems to match what was forcasted days before. Not what is actually happening!

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi Derek,
we using two weather providers, is this happen in both providers?

title: Weather is never right?

author: David Belvedere
comment: I really like the look of this watch face. Even though there seems to be a lot going on, it appears to be easy on my Moto 360 v2 battery life. Only one complaint: I have a very hard time activating the interactive features.  The Fitness stats activate easily, but the battery stats are hard to open, and the weather information  (which I believe is vital) is almost impossible to access. Fix that, and I  update my rating to 5 stars. Otherwise, thanks for a good looking watch face!

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi David,
thanks for your feedback. You are the second, with Moto 360 v2 who has same issue with tapping on are that are near the watch edges.. In one of upcoming releases we try to set wider area for tapping zones..
Best regards
Pavel

title: Nice look and features

author: Charles Barnes
comment: It's dynamic with the weather and time of day. I love it. Doesn't drain battery much either -moto 360 v1
title: Pretty great watch face

author: Ashley Lewis
comment: I love this watch face!  Very well done and super cute! Thank you!

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi Ashley,
Many thanks to you. We are glad to see satisfied user of our watch faces.

We still work hard and you can look forward to a new detailed weather forecast and Google Fit data in a some of the upcoming releases.

title: Exactly what I was looking for!

author: Eddie Young
comment: Superb watchface. Like the animation and interactive elements such as weather.
title: My favourite!

author: Rafael
comment: Great purchase , unique design. Awesome JOB , you can even call it the swiss knife of watch faces.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi Rafael Alejandro,
Many thanks to you. We are glad to see satisfied user of our watch faces.

We still work hard and you can look forward to a new detailed weather forecast and Google Fit data in a some of the upcoming releases

title: I'm recommending this to my friends.

author: Dave S
comment: A great looking watch face, but it needs a little fix. Like others have said, I can't get the weather to update. Says it's 13 degrees, but it's 64. Also, the step counter says 0 all the time. Fix these things and I'll definitely give 5 stars and purchase other faces.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
For the step issue:

Check the status of Google Fit API and disconect the WatchFace  
workflow: http://prntscr.com/8w6lwx

After disconnection, run the Active Weather app again and the dialog will there again

title: I would love to give 5 stars

author: SKaTeLEE GAmeR
comment: This is a great and beautiful watch face and a fast response from the developer! Thank you and great app!👍😀

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
If I understand correctly, the only one problem is, that the dialog of allowing right to application using Google Fit API is not shown http://prntscr.com/8w6fsp

Check the status of Google Fit API and disconect the WatchFace  
workflow: http://prntscr.com/8w6lwx

After disconnection, run the Active Weather app again and the dialog will there again

title: Good app with good interface!

author: David Buck
comment: Reminds me a an old Pebble wallpaper. Which I have been looking for!

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content:
Hi, good idea we will add this feature to the next release 1.05. 
Edit: option hide/unhide indicator will be available in few hours. Version 1.05 has been already released

title: Awesome!

author: Houston Cleaver
comment: Not even after a refresh
title: Great but weather isn't updating ever

author: David Dodge
comment: I'm actually impressed. The animations are smooth, the look is great, and the added functionality of being able to tap on various indicators for more info is convenient. The only suggestion I have is to move the sun and moon behind the mountains, for proper perspective.
title: Awesome

author: Scott Moore
comment: Looks great and uses very little battery, even with animations on. Would like a little more customization.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content: Hi Scott, can you advice me what to add for more customization? You can send me an e-mail to huskydevcz@gmail.com

title: Great watchface

author: Daniel Jarvis
comment: This watch face is beautiful and smooth, but cannot get my distance measured to change to miles instead of kilometers.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content: Hi, this issue was fixed in 1.03 which you already have. Try to change speed unit in configuration activity to imperial again. Screenshot http://prntscr.com/8suuu7

title: ATTN: Dev

author: Alex Popko
comment: Amazing watch face, but cannot switch to imperial and Fahrenheit.

reply.author: HuskyDev
reply.content: Hi, this issue was fixed in 1.03 which you already have. Try to change speed unit in configuration activity to imperial again. Screenshot http://prntscr.com/8suuu7

title: Cannot change units
